DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled multicenter study is to determine in a cohort of 506 patients with acute ischemic stroke in the middle cerebral artery territory, the effect of a three-day high-dose, intravenous erythropoietin treatment on functional outcome up to a follow-up of 90 days.
DOC.brief_title: Multicenter Efficacy Study of Recombinant Human Erythropoietin in Acute Ischemic Stroke
DOC.criteria: Ischemic stroke in the middle cerebral artery territory Clearly defined time of onset Confirmed by MRI (DWI, Flair) NIH Stroke Scale ≥ 5 Age > 18 years Treatment within 6h after onset of symptoms Informed consent by patient, relatives or independent physician Life expectancy > 90 days Coma or precoma (level of consciousness ≥ 2 in NIH Stroke Scale) Previous stroke within the same territory Intracranial or subarachnoidal hemorrhage Traumatic brain injury or brain operation within the last 4 weeks Neoplasia, septic embolism, infectious endocarditis MRI contraindications Renal failure (i.e. dependent on dialysis) Known malignant/lifethreatening disease Known myeloproliferative disorder, polycythemia Known allergy or antibodies against erythropoietin Participation in other intervention trials Pregnancy
DOC.keyword: Ischemic stroke in the middle cerebral artery territory
